intro: Dortmanna berteroi, commonly known as the common dock, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their characteristic arrow-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with smooth, waxy leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Dortmanna berteroi is often found in moist soils along riverbanks, wet meadows, and other damp habitats.
